metadata.synopsis: Ceremony of Gortash becoming the Grand Duke.The start of the dialog depends on whether Steel Watchers are enabled (present) or not.In the dialog Gortash tells you to kill Orin and then concludes the ceremony. Player can attack but it would be very hard to win.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Debug Book - Quest Flags & Setup - Act 3 (WYR) - Kill Director Gortash - GoTo Ceremony.

167.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
167.context: InternalNodeContext: Contingency node if we need to add extra lines

383.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
383.context: InternalNodeContext: Contingency node if we need to add extra lines

427.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
427.context: InternalNodeContext: Contingency node if we need to add extra lines

186.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
186.context: InternalNodeContext: Contingency node if we need to add extra lines

70.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
70.context: InternalNodeContext: Contingency node if we need to add extra lines

180.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
180.context: InternalNodeContext: Contingency node if we need to add extra lines

286.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
286.context: InternalNodeContext: Contingency node if we need to add extra lines

211.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
211.context: InternalNodeContext: Contingency node if we need to add extra lines

422.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
422.text: Lord Enver Gortash, the people cry your name. Will you -
422.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to room and then to Gortash as part of speech gesturing his arms enthusiastically.

253.speaker: Narrator
253.text: *For the briefest moment, you are one with Duke Ravengard. His mind is void - a vessel of the Absolute, awaiting command.*
253.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mind meld with Ravengard for one node.

437.speaker: Wyll
437.context: NodeContext: Wyll sees his father, surprised.

80.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
80.text: My Lord. We have a guest.

310.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
310.text: Exquisite timing. Dearest patriars, but a moment. Lord Enver Gortash at your service.
310.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash looks to player and smiles wide. He speaks to the room gesturing his arms enthusiastically while walking down the stairs to get closer to the player. First line is addressed to the room and second line is addressed to the player.

400.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
400.text: Karlach! My dear, aren't you a sight for sore eyes. How long has it been? Five years? Six? I'm delighted to see you again.

234.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
234.text: From earth do we rise. In fire are we forged. In steel are we mighty!
234.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ravengard speaks to the room as the player approaches. Addressed to the room as part of speech from the top of the stairs gesturing his arms enthusiastically and pausing a bit in between each phrases. The players and peanuts walks in.NodeContext: The end of a rousing speech.

275.speaker: Narrator
275.text: Stand down, villain. In the name of the Steel Watch.
275.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Steel Watcher blocks the player.

433.text: Aggressive action will not be tolerated in the presence of the patriars of this proud city.
433.context: CinematicNodeContext: The machine gears up to attack.

184.speaker: Player
184.text: Point taken. I'll keep things peaceful.

382.text: The Steel Watch appreciate your cooperation, citizen.
382.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Watcher stays menacing, ready to attack.NodeContext: Gets new command after starting to engage. Gortash sends a remote command to let the player through.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: I'm not taking orders from a piece of metal.

442.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Watcher stays menacing, ready to attack.NodeContext: Gets new command after starting to engage. Gortash sends a remote command to let the player through.

162.text: You will not survive this encounter, citizen.
162.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Watcher stays menacing, ready to attack.NodeContext: Gets new command after starting to engage. Gortash sends a remote command to let the player through.

89.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
89.text: Dearest patriars, but a moment. I must greet a most honoured guest.
89.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player. Second line, addressed to the room as he excuses himself.NodeContext: Magninamously and a bir formal, but still in the style of a politician where you can't tell if he's being sarcastic

374.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
374.text: Dearest patriars, dearest Ravengard, but a moment. The Blade of Frontiers graces our halls.

288.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
288.text: Crawling back from their bloody disgrace - it's my favourite assassin! Gods, you're a sight for sore eyes.
288.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash looks to player and smiles wide. He speaks his arms enthusiastically while walking down the stairs to get closer to the player. Steelwatcher goes back to neutral friendly position.

274.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
274.text: Orin told me she made a fool of you, but I should've known you wouldn't go down that easy.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: I have no clue what you're talking about - my memories are blighted.

115.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
115.text: Then she didn't lie - the past is lost to you. Let me clear up some mysteries, then. We share so much history.

271.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
271.text: You and I initiated this plot. We discussed in depth the failures of our predecessors and how to avoid them.

280.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
280.text: We understood that if we were to unite, no one could stand in the way of the Dead Three.

376.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
376.text: So unite we did. First we obtained the crown; then we enslaved the brain. From there, it was but a small step to the most successful religious hoax ever perpetrated.

402.speaker: Player
402.text: What does the cult of the Absolute have to do with this?

367.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
367.text: It was all going so well - until you vanished. Orin informed us that henceforth she would speak for the temple of Bhaal, and act on their behalf.

95.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
95.text: But she made a mess of things. Unlike you, she cannot control herself.

232.speaker: Karlach
232.text: Hang on. What the fuck is going on here?
232.context: NodeContext: incredulous to find that the dark urge avatqar and Gortash have a long history together

381.speaker: Player
381.text: You misread me. I've come to end this evil plot.

352.speaker: Player
352.text: You are mistaken if you think I can control myself.

227.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
227.text: Have you gone soft? I find that hard to believe. One's true nature always rises to the top.

159.speaker: Player
159.text: I'm back now, and a reckoning awaits.

397.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
397.text: Indeed you are. Look at you - cold-blooded as ever.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: How dare Orin take my place. I'll make her pay.

26.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
26.text: Good, good. I can see you are still your old self.

5.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
5.text: When Ketheric fell, I feared the worst. That our plans would fail like so many before. Because of discord among ourselves.

69.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
69.text: Now you've returned, we can achieve all of our dreams still. You brought Thorm's Netherstone.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: I don't remember a thing, but the plan sounds brilliant!

155.speaker: Player
155.text: What was my role in this plan?

405.speaker: Player
405.text: Ask the Emperor: Is he telling the truth?

200.speaker: Player
200.text: I like your tone! But humour me: I have amnesia.

100.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
100.text: My friend - forgive the cold welcome. My Steel Watchers are eager watchdogs. For the good of the people, I'm sure you understand.
100.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash looks to player and smiles wide. He speaks his arms enthusiastically while walking down the stairs to get closer to the player. Steelwatcher goes back to neutral friendly position.NodeContext: Politician through and through. Charismatic enough to understand how he's so popular. Sllimy enough for his bad faith to shine through,

368.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
368.text: But - my stars! That can't be my old friend Karlach, can it? How long has it been? Five years? Six? I'm delighted to see you again.

68.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
68.text: Lord Enver Gortash at your service.
68.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash boes deeply as he introduces himself

173.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
173.text: I understand congratulations are in order. Thorm's defeat hasn't gone unnoticed. You're known - for who you are, and for that Netherstone that you carry.

154.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
154.text: Ah - and my old friend Karlach. It's no wonder your victory was so decisive. It's lovely to see you again, darling.

166.speaker: Karlach
166.context: NodeContext: Rictus grin trying not to rip his head off

414.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
414.text: We'll catch up once we've covered more pressing matters - Thorm's Netherstone, more to the point.

330.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
330.text: I knew I'd meet Ketheric's slayer eventually, but I had no idea it was you, Karlach.

177.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
177.text: You have Thorm's Netherstone. We must discuss what that means.

254.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
254.text: You know, it takes all three to control the brain. Without Thorm's, it's become vexingly wilful.
254.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash raises his gauntlet, in which the netherstone gem gleams. He gazes upon it with awe as he turns his arm about before lowering his arm again.

270.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
270.text: The quakes are a clear warning. If nobody steps in soon, it'll free itself from the authority of the crown.

49.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
49.text: I expect it'll start with turning the Sword Coast's infected - you among them. That Prism of yours won't last indefinitely.

168.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
168.text: Next, the Grand Design. The mind flayer empire reborn. If we're lucky, we'll become slaves. If we're unlucky, well -

40.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
40.text: A bleak prospect. But it's a fate that can be avoided if you and I renew our old partnership.

31.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
31.text: Not the most thrilling of prospects. But it's a fate that can be avoided if you and I come to an understanding.

112.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
112.text: You may have wrought the destruction of my Iron Throne, brought my Steel Watch to its knees - but that's how I know you'd make a most formidable ally.

39.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
39.text: You may have wrought the destruction of my Iron Throne - but that's how I know you'd make a most formidable ally.

50.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
50.text: Together we can still restore authority over the brain.

1.text: Of course. Gortash always did have an eye for opportunity...
1.context:
NodeContext: telepathic, Emperor not physically present (speaking directly into player's mind)
Reflecting on the fact that Gortash is now proposing an alliance with the player. Hates Gortash though, so this is with an edge of resentment.

388.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
388.text: You should know better than most, Karlach, the risks of falling out of my favour.

398.speaker: Player
398.text: What kind of partnership do you have in mind?

379.speaker: Player
379.text: What kind of understanding do you suggest?

446.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
446.text: There is an old wisdom: a brittle alliance can never be mended - it can only break.

7.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
7.text: With Ketheric felled, Orin proves treacherous. She craves the Netherstones for her own, desperate to impress Bhaal.

202.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
202.text: She only cares for blood. And your blood and mine are of particular interest to her.

394.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
394.text: You've met her assassins. Efficient killers by all accounts. I know you survived previous encounters. But she won't relent.

17.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
17.text: Her assassins hunt you even now. They are very efficient killers. Even someone with your talents should take heed.

158.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
158.text: Orin changes shape faster than you and I change clothes. You know. She's tricked you before.

34.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
34.text: She's targeted me as well. I'm well protected, but she's extremely good at what she does.

216.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
216.text: If Orin obtains all three Netherstones, she'll plunge the Coast into chaos and paint the city in blood.

118.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
118.text: I can't let that happen. I want to lead this city to glory - not scorch its earth.

284.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
284.text: So I turn to the scion of Bhaal. You are his dear Sovereign - he created you to rule.

435.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
435.text: Let's make our pact anew. A divine oath, sworn upon spirit and flesh. I do no harm to you, nor you to me.

246.speaker: Player
246.text: It's going to take a lot to make me trust you.

218.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
218.text: So I turn to you, the former ruler of the cult of Bhaal.

109.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
109.text: I'd like to propose a pact. A divine oath, sworn upon spirit and flesh. I do no harm to you, nor you to me.

163.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
163.text: Furthermore, you'll have nothing to fear from my Steel Watch while our pact stands.

151.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
151.text: Thorm's stone is yours to keep. When you slay Orin and take her stone, you bring it here, so the three are united once again.

53.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
53.text: Together we rule Faerûn as kings. No, more than kings - gods. We rule as the Absolute.

294.speaker: Narrator
294.text: *The Urge, the deplorably brutal Urge sickens within you. When you level the world over, that dead world must be yours alone.*

219.speaker: Narrator
219.text: *But first you will rule. Then, you will ruin.*

426.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
426.text: What do you say? Shall we be allies?

281.speaker: Karlach
281.text: I can detect no deceit. This alliance could serve us well. And if it does not... well, we need not honour it.
281.context: NodeContext: telepathic, Emperor not physically present

123.text: He lies. He means to betray you. But this need not preclude an alliance. You could be the one to betray him.
123.context: NodeContext: telepathic, Emperor not physically present

449.speaker: Karlach
449.text: 'Let's be allies,' said the viper to the frog.

14.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
14.text: He wants what we want - Orin dead, and the elder brain subjugated. An alliance would serve us well.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Orin betrayed me, and you did nothing to help me then. What has changed?

79.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
79.text: We would not meddle in each other's affairs - this was our agreement. She came to us as Bhaal's Chosen. We are but servants to our lords.

15.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
15.text: Your presence here means your lord sees a purpose for you yet.

78.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
78.text: I tolerated Orin, but I liked you.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: I seem to have trusted you once, and it ruined me. I'm not about to repeat that mistake.

77.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
77.text: I am not Orin; I know the value of alliance. Bane teaches his followers to reward those who support his chosen, not to betray them.

98.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
98.text: You and I always knew we could only stand against the world united.

237.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
237.text: Orin's blind ambition failed us. She compromised you, just when success seemed certain. Ketheric? His obsession with his daughter made him lose all hold on reason.

299.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
299.text: They floundered, even as they tried to rise above us. We will not, can not make that mistake if we come together in trust.

418.speaker: Player
418.text: As allies, it seems none of you can be trusted. You, Orin, Ketheric.

302.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
302.text: So Ketheric was ready to betray our alliance, too?

51.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
51.text: I can't say it comes as a surprise. But you should know this:

8.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
8.text: I initiated this plot. I brought Ketheric and Orin together to create the Absolute.

421.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
421.text: They knew this would only work if we stood united and coordinated our powers.

91.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
91.text: Their ambition blinded them to reason. I don't suffer the same affliction.

393.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
393.text: In short - you can trust me.

178.speaker: Player
178.text: I will defeat Orin and we shall be allies. You have my oath.

107.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
107.text: Then let it be writ by the Black Hand of Bane. I, Lord Enver Gortash, swear I shall do you no harm. We will rise together over Toril as a roaring sun.

343.speaker: Karlach
343.text: This isn't going to end well. Mark my words.

145.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
145.text: I understand your concerns, my old friend, but allow me to demonstrate why you made the right choice.

131.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
131.text: Let me demonstrate why you made the right choice.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: I'll think about it. No promises.

153.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
153.text: Perhaps a demonstration of why you need my help will motivate you to make the right decision.

384.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
384.text: Your camp is compromised. One among you is an impostor. A Faceless.

262.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
262.text: Who, I can't say. I'd suggest a thorough investigation - you'll find I speak truth.

389.speaker: Lae'zel
389.text: A doppelganger - hidden among us? Tsk'va!

233.speaker: Shadowheart
233.text: A doppelganger in our camp? That sounds all too believable.

425.speaker: Karlach
425.text: Take that with a grain of salt. This is Gortash we're talking to.

342.speaker: Minsc
342.text: Don't look at me. And don't you dare look at Boo.
342.context: NodeContext: Player looking to him after being told there's a shapeshifter among us. First line is shrugged, nonchalant. Second line is genuinely offended, mildly aghast that it might even occur to us

87.speaker: Astarion
87.text: A shapeshifter? It could be anyone.

136.speaker: Astarion
136.text: I mean - it's not me, but it could be anyone else.
136.context: NodeContext: Follows "A shape-shifter? It could be anyone."

88.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
88.text: The faceless in your camp is like a knife at your throat. Remove it, quickly, or any alliance between us would be exceedingly short-lived.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: The faceless in my camp was Orin herself. She took someone - I need to find her.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: How am I supposed to find Orin if she can change her form so easily?

430.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
430.text: Even horror has a home. Find her nest, and slay her there.

377.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
377.text: The Bhaal Temple, your old haunt, now reeks of her ichors.

291.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
291.text: Hm. Do you even remember how to find it?

122.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
122.text: It's a secret even to me.

242.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
242.text: You're resourceful - I trust you'll sniff it out. If the trail goes cold, follow the bodies.

149.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
149.text: For all its charms, Baldur's Gate has long had a cancer at its heart - a hidden temple, devoted to Bhaal.

104.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
104.text: That's where Orin became what she is, where she worshipped and schemed.

279.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
279.text: And now it's where she hides from my Watchers when she's not spilling blood in the streets.

143.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
143.text: And now it's where she hides from me when she's not spilling blood in the streets.

269.speaker: Player
269.text: Me, you, Ketheric, the brain. What was the plan before Orin interfered?

239.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
239.text: In Bhaal's name, you set your bloody daggers to cause panic in the streets, killing in the Absolute's name.

419.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
419.text: You would have carried out that part of the plan, had Orin not ruined your hard work.

304.speaker: Player
304.text: You, Orin, Ketheric, the brain. What was your plan?

346.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
346.text: First, Orin the Red, bloody dagger of Bhaal, causes panic in the streets through killings in the Absolute's name.

81.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
81.text: Next, the threat of the Absolute's monstrous armies formed by Myrkul's general, Ketheric Thorm.

86.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
86.text: In such circumstances, people crave strong leaders. Leaders that bring law, order, and protection. Leaders like me, Bane's unyielding hand, author of justice.

354.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
354.text: You are soon to witness the people of Baldur's Gate granting me complete power over them. All out of fear of the Absolute.

399.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
399.text: Next, I - we - will declare curfew and begin infecting the masses. Our subjects will hear the voice of their Absolute god.

373.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
373.text: The faithful will do anything in the name of their god.

241.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
241.text: Yes, yes, I'm sure I do.

300.speaker: Player
300.text: Glorious. Then let us be gods, you and I.

59.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
59.text: You already are, in your blood. It is simply a matter of getting the world to see it.

174.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
174.text: Our tyranny. And we are saviours. Defenders of the Sword Coast. Our loyal subjects will love us, not hate us.

55.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
55.text: What comes next will be entirely their fault.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: Where in the Nine Hells did you find a powerful artefact like the crown?

272.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
272.text: Powerful connections. Let's leave it at that.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: I've heard enough. Am I free to go?

38.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
38.text: Soon. First, come and be witness as I make history as the first Archduke of Baldur's Gate.

309.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
309.text: Now come, be witness as I make history as the first Archduke of Baldur's Gate.

371.speaker: Player
371.text: I'd rather juice my own eyes.

370.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
370.text: Be that as it may, you will sit quietly and watch as history is made.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: I wouldn't dream of missing it.

358.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
358.text: Then we proceed. The patriars await.

441.speaker: Player
441.text: Fine. Let's get it over with.

349.speaker: Player
349.text: I have no interest in this sham of a ceremony.

326.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
326.text: This is the first step towards our glory. I really must insist.

366.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
366.text: Then allow me to pique it for you.

191.speaker: Narrator
191.text: *Your brain twists and stretches under the Watcher's gaze. The pain almost brings you to your knees before fading.*
191.context: CinematicNodeContext: The camera shows a nearby steel watcher. It twists your brain into knots. Player is in agonizing pain, gripping their head, then releasing it at the end as the watcher releases its hold on you.

217.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
217.text: You will follow me. And you will show due respect.

249.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
249.text: Distinguished dukes, patriars. Dearest Ravengard - I will heed your call. A new chapter begins.
249.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash walks from the player and addresses the partriars in the room beforemaking a 180 turn with his back to player. Player and peanuts stepping back.

236.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash approaches Ravengard. Ravengard nods and steps forward. He holds a sword aloft - the sword of Balduran, perhaps. Gortash kneels, back to player. Everyone takes position for the Archduke ceremony.

411.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
411.text: Enver Gortash. Swearest thou, by Balduran's blade, to defend the citizens of Baldur's Gate from enemies within and without?
411.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash is kneeling and looking down. Ravenguard put the blade on top of Gortash's left shoulder and hold that position.

392.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
392.context: NodeContext: Gortadsh is still kneeling looking down.

365.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
365.text: Swearest thou true faith and fealty to the same, by word, deed, and decree, so that none may suffer?
365.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ravenguard move to top of the blade from Gortash left shoulder to his right shoulder. Gortadsh is still kneeling looking down (looping idle)

243.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
243.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ravenguard goes back in loop idle with the weapon pointing down from Gortash right shoulder.NodeContext: Gortadsh is still kneeling looking down.

417.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
417.context: NodeContext: Ravenguard is in loop idle weapon pointing down.

263.speaker: Player
263.text: There is no more evil bastard in all of Baldur's Gate than this prick! Do not swear him in as your ruler.

92.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
92.text: Pay no mind to this madwoman. She's a jealous old hanger-on who'd ruin me for the crime of my success in protecting our fair city.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Stop this. Gortash and Ravengard are with the Absolute!

325.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
325.text: Don't. You'll only invite his ire. And your own death.
325.context: NodeContext: telepathic, Emperor not physically present (speaking directly into player's head)

313.speaker: Lae'zel
313.text: Hold your tongue. This horde could bring even a mounted kith'rak to her knees.

194.speaker: Shadowheart
194.text: Silence can be very powerful, you know. Especially when it saves our lives.
194.context: NodeContext: 'Please don't cause a scene/pick a fight we can't win' Aside to player

210.speaker: Karlach
210.text: Hang on - we're at a strategic disadvantage here. Better to take down those machines, then rip Gortash's throat out.

139.speaker: Minsc
139.text: Speak, friend! They may have overwhelming numbers, but the glorious deaths will be ours.
139.context: NodeContext: A quiet aside, revving up for battle. Player is about to speak and pick a very tough fight by doing so (some other companions warn against it) Aside to player

298.speaker: Astarion
298.text: I know that look: the 'I'm about to do something incredibly stupid' look. There are enough of them to turn us into paste, so maybe don't? Just this once.
298.context: NodeContext: An aside to the player

61.speaker: Wyll
61.text: Keep calm, I beg you. If we do battle, my father will perish at our own hands.

192.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
192.text: Enver Gortash. The Council appoints you Archduke of Baldur's Gate.
192.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash raises the sword still pojnting down to conclude the ceremony.

290.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
290.text: My friends - today, a new covenant is forged. Together, we will stand against the evil forces plaguing our dear city!
290.context: NodeContext: Spoken to all attendees of the ceremony.

120.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
120.text: And you, honoured guest, will find me in my office above when you return. Do not come empty-handed.
120.context: NodeContext: Addressed to player after speaking to assembled audience.

362.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
362.text: My friends. The Steel Watch stands ready. Let its blade fall on any who would diminish our city!
362.context: CinematicNodeContext: He speaks his arms enthusiastically. Addressed to the crowd.  Gortash stands pleased and turns right 180 to player and smiles.NodeContext: Spoken to all attendees of the ceremony.

20.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
20.text: My friends - today, a new covenant is forged. Together, we will stand against the evil forces plaguing our dear city!
20.context: NodeContext: Spoken to all attendees of the ceremony.

301.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
301.text: Follow me to my office above. We can be good for each other.
301.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash walks close the right side of the player a bit past him and look by his shoulder to address him. And then walks on after delevering the line.NodeContext: Addressed to the player, more close to himm not looking at him.

406.speaker: Player
406.text: Stop this. Gortash and Ravengard are with the Absolute!

82.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
82.text: A traitor's words - they mean to fracture this Council!

45.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
45.text: Watchers - to arms. The War of the Absolute has begun.
45.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash stands up angrily and the steelwatcher are gearing up for combat.

169.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
169.text: Patriars - let it be known. The War of the Absolute has begun.
169.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash stands up and the steelwatcher are gearing up for combat.

126.speaker: Gale
126.text: Let's take a breath - the odds are stacked against us if we try to pick a fight now.

267.speaker: Narrator
267.text: *Doubts cloud your mind. This is not a battle you're likely to win.*

431.speaker: Lae'zel
431.text: Hold your tongue. Gortash and his allies could bring even a mounted kith'rak to her knees.

340.speaker: Shadowheart
340.text: Silence can be an excellent tool, you know. Especially if it spares you an unwinnable fight.
340.context: NodeContext: 'Please don't cause a scene/pick a fight we can't win' Aside to player

185.speaker: Karlach
185.text: The machines might be scrap. But that doesn't mean we've got the advantage.

235.speaker: Minsc
235.text: Speak, friend! The overwhelming numbers are theirs, but the glorious deaths will be ours.
235.context: NodeContext: A quiet aside, revving up for battle. Player is about to speak and pick a very tough fight by doing so (some other companions warn against it) Aside to player

297.speaker: Astarion
297.text: I know that look: the 'I'm about to do something incredibly stupid' look. There are enough of them to turn us into paste, so maybe don't? Just this once.
297.context: NodeContext: An aside to the player

135.speaker: Wyll
135.text: Keep calm, I beg you. If we do battle, my father will perish at our own hands.

3.speaker: Gale
3.text: Let's let cooler heads prevail, eh? I'm not sure I like our odds if we pick a fight here.

90.speaker: Narrator
90.text: *Doubts cloud your mind. This is not a battle you're likely to win.*

24.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
24.text: The young Ravengard is with the Absolute. He means to disrupt this council.

148.speaker: Player
148.text: This stops now Gortash. I'm taking you out.

117.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
117.text: It's not. But it will not follow new orders unless the Netherstones are united to give the command.

331.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
331.text: When it finishes executing its current orders, it will be free to do as it wishes. That would be bad for everyone.

240.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
240.text: The crown's magic turned the brain into something the world has never seen - a Netherbrain. Its power is immense.

359.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
359.text: Once it is freed from its shackles, I doubt we'll ever be able to bring it under control again.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Surely your Steel Watch can handle Orin. Why do you need me?

144.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
144.text: Orin is... elusive, shall we say. The grip of the Steel Watch may be tight, but sand still slips through its fingers.

289.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
289.text: Some conflicts are best resolved quietly. The people are cattle: obedient until panicked.

444.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
444.text: You carry the stone plucked from Myrkul's Chosen, besides. Why call you 'enemy' when I could repair an old friendship?

56.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
56.text: You carry the stone plucked from Myrkul's Chosen, besides. I am not ready to call you 'enemy'.

295.speaker: Player
295.text: Surely the Flaming Fist could handle Orin. Why do you need me?

323.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
323.text: Orin is... slippery, shall we say. She even eluded my Steel Watch - before you destroyed it.

150.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
150.text: She would slip like sand through the Flaming Fist's fingers.

66.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
66.text: Before you do, come witness as I make history as the first Archduke of Baldur's Gate.

230.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
230.text: Let this be a warning. Orin will be your downfall, or you will be hers. We make an alliance, and you will be the victor.

201.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
201.text: Let this be a warning. Orin is the spark in a powderkeg. We make an alliance - or the city is made ash.

255.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
255.text: I will give you time to reconsider.

336.text: Tread carefully. Remember, you must do what it takes to survive. Even if it means striking a deal with the enemy.

258.speaker: Player
258.text: The brain, the crown, it will all be mine. And I won't share.

113.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
113.text: Orin was right - you're playing the fool. With all the unthinking greed of your god.

338.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
338.text: Oh, but I most certainly am not.

141.speaker: Player
141.text: You're a dead man. I can't let you take over the city.

248.speaker: Lae'zel
248.text: Calm yourself. These Watchers could bring even a mounted kith'rak to her knees.

108.speaker: Shadowheart
108.text: No. Those Watchers are liable to turn us into cat food if we move a muscle.
108.context: NodeContext: 'don't be rash - we're outgunned' - Aside to player

33.speaker: Karlach
33.text: Hang on - we're at a strategic disadvantage here. Better to take down those machines, then rip Gortash's throat out.

121.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
121.text: Sage advice. My Steel Watchers take unkindly to threats - no matter how hollow.
121.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera moves in on a nearby Steel Watcher automaton.

124.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
124.text: You are of little use to me dead, but dead is exactly what you will be if you arouse the ire of my Steel Watch.

356.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
356.text: Such pluck! How I admire it. Alas, I take unkindly to threats - no matter how hollow.
356.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera moves in on a nearby Steel Watcher automaton.

277.speaker: Minsc
277.text: You've kept your honour, friend. Even if our enemy has every other advantage.
277.context: NodeContext: Approving - meant to be a more mildly humorous than dramatic. We've chosen to pick a very tough fight in which we'll surely die - Minsc is communicating that, but with satisfied approval. Aside to player

175.speaker: Astarion
175.text: You're bluffing, right? Because those contraptions could turn us to paste.

205.speaker: Wyll
205.text: Please, stay your hand. My father's life is at stake.

410.speaker: Gale
410.text: Don't - we'd face very poor odds if you start a fight now.

317.speaker: Narrator
317.text: *Doubt casts a shadow on your mind. You've little chance to best Gortash's Steel Watchers.*

353.speaker: Player
353.text: I am ending this here, consequences be damned.

287.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
287.text: Tut. So much potential, gone to waste. Watchers - the Absolute's assassins walk among us!
287.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gearing up for combat.NodeContext: "Tut" read aloud like a word (as opposed to a dental click).

133.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
133.text: Tut. So much potential, gone to waste. Patriars - let it be known. The Absolute's assassins walk among us!
133.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gearing up for combat.NodeContext: "Tut" read aloud like a word (as opposed to a dental click).

21.speaker: Wyll
21.text: An impostor? But who in the Hells...

220.speaker: Gale
220.text: A doppelganger in our camp? A little redundant of me to say, but that could be anyone.

206.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
206.text: As vulgar as ever, I see.

293.speaker: Player
293.text: To the hells with your pact.

395.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
395.text: What a shame to refuse the power of a god.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: What about my father? What will happen to him?

72.speaker: Player
72.text: Examine Gortash's body language and expressions. Can you trust him?

103.speaker: Narrator
103.text: *Gortash's eyes blink in a consistent rhythm. He stands calmly, confidently. He fully intends to share his kingdom with you.*

152.speaker: Narrator
152.text: *You note a flicker in Gortash's eyes. You have already destroyed that which he held dear. His promises are empty ones.*

130.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
130.text: Orin is unreliable. This one - this one shows promise. They keep their word, I keep mine. We will rule as one.
130.context: CinematicNodeContext: Detect Thought (Lead In | Lead Out)

229.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
229.text: This wretch has left destruction in their wake, made me a mockery. They will bring me the Netherstone - and then I will crush them.
229.context: CinematicNodeContext: Detect Thought (Lead In | Lead Out)

347.speaker: Narrator
347.context: CinematicNodeContext: Detect Thought (Lead In | Lead Out)

387.speaker: Astarion
387.text: An ally could be useful, at least for now. And when he's no longer useful - well, we can dispose of him then.

105.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
105.text: Your father will do whatever you command him to, like any other subject in our kingdom.

303.speaker: Narrator
303.text: *Darkness stirs in you. Bhaal demands blood - and there is none blacker than that of Orin, his own Chosen.*

157.speaker: Player
157.text: You want me to believe you mean no harm to the city?

127.speaker: Player
127.text: It's going to take a lot to make me trust you.

213.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
213.text: Orin changes shape faster than you and I change clothes. She might be anywhere.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: If she wants my blood, she'll have to find me first.

440.speaker: Player
440.text: Perhaps she and I can be allies.

423.speaker: Player
423.text: I will bring her to heel.

85.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
85.text: With Ketheric gone, Orin proves treacherous. She wants the Netherstones for herself.

447.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
447.text: With Ketheric gone, Orin proved treacherous. Bhaal's Chosen wants the Netherstones for herself.

319.speaker: Player
319.text: I want to avenge myself. I want to strike at Orin.

208.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
208.text: Ousting Orin and helping you reclaim your birthright would be my greatest honour.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: I'm a changed person, I'm not siding with you ever again.

320.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
320.text: Bhaal isn't done with you, you must know that. You have effortless talents, killing instinctually like you breathe blood.

311.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
311.text: Stand with Bhaal, or it will spell your doom. But I can offer some aid for the storm you are about to weather.

327.speaker: Player
327.text: I'm not interested in bargaining with the likes of you.

415.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
415.text: The likes of you stand to benefit from the likes of me.

222.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
222.text: You may have brought my Steel Watch to its knees - but that's how I know you'd make a most formidable ally.

345.speaker: Player
345.text: You're awfully friendly for the man who sold me to a devil ten years ago.

363.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
363.text: Time flies, doesn't it? But never mind that - we have much to discuss. You have a Netherstone. That makes us allies.

225.speaker: Player
225.text: Discuss? Ha. I've come to burn your head off your body.

312.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
312.text: Now, now, Karlach, let's not be hasty. We've begun something far greater than that temper of yours. You have a Netherstone. That bears discussion.

351.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
351.text: Ah! My dear friend, what a brilliant child you've been to your Father. It must feel good to be the favourite. Orin must still be screaming in the Hells.

314.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
314.text: Ah - and my old friend Karlach. It's no wonder your victory was so decisive. How have you been, darling?

84.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
84.text: Let's catch up later, hmm? We have more important business.
84.context: NodeContext: Rictus grin trying not to rip his head off

333.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
333.text: My master admires you, as I always have. For the slaughter you bring, and for the Netherstones you bear.

57.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
57.text: My master knows you - for who you are, and for the Netherstones that you carry.

93.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
93.text: Oh, yes - we've much to discuss. But first, come and be witness as I make history as the first Archduke of Baldur's Gate.

228.speaker: Player
228.text: You have so much to answer for. You think I want to watch you become an Archduke?

11.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
11.text: We can discuss personal matters another time, Karlach. Believe me, you won't like what happens if you think to challenge me here, now.

428.speaker: Player
428.text: Let the ceremony begin. I wouldn't dream of missing it.

125.speaker: Player
125.text: Fine. Let's get this sham coronation over with.

188.speaker: Player
188.text: How about I take your head instead?

62.speaker: Player
62.text: I killed her to make amends for my past. You are next.

436.speaker: Player
436.text: I am ending this here, consequences be damned.

364.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
364.text: And you are: a marvel. You've brought Ketheric to his knees and made Orin grovel.

429.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
429.text: Lord Enver Gortash at your service.
429.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the player, does a Lord Farquaad kind of bow.
